alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Murray; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 11:05PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Catoosa, north central Murray, Whitfield and central Walker Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1105 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near East Brainerd to near Blue Spring to near Cooper Heights, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Dalton, Ringgold, Varnell, Eton, Tunnel Hill, Cohutta, Crandall, Sumac, Noble, Wood Station, Indian Springs, Rocky Face, Gregory, Graysville, Blue Spring, Tennga, Boynton, Beaumont, Beaverdale and Dawnville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for northwestern Georgia.
